sentence.text: CGD is a genetically heterogeneous disease with an X-linked recessive (XR-CGD) form caused by mutations in the superoxide metabolic process (OMIM #300481) gene encoding the gp91(phox) protein, and an autosomal recessive (AR-CGD) form caused by mutations in the cytochrome complex assembly (OMIM #608508), protein targeting to membrane (OMIM #608512), NCF2 (OMIM #608515) and NCF4 (OMIM #601488) genes encoding p22(phox), p47(phox), p67(phox) and p40(phox), respectively.
